description:
Great app, the snap packaging doesn't have the dependency or segfault issue of the website's .debian package.

The only problem is that when the app is installed from snapcraft, I don't see the proper icon in the dash, just a cog. Please update!

To me the music seems more dynamic though this app compared to full browser.

Also for me there is an added bonus in that this app doesn't get lost in the myriad of open tabs that accumulate in Chrome.

Thank you so much for sharing this.
Very nice app! Much better than the official Google Play Music App.
Thank you for the app. Works very well. The only issue is exactly the same one reported by Foxmilk (with the icon)
I was looking for the desktop experience with play music and finally I found it. Thank you!

I have GPMDP on all of my linux installs. It's a fantastic program supporting both GP and exprimentally, youtube music. The integrations have everything I can ask for and have an exposed JSON api if there's something you don't like.

On Ubuntu, I believe it installs as a snap and so the icon isn't reported correctly. I'm not sure if this is how it's packaged or something Ubuntu does, but it would be nice to fix it.
Love the app, great work! Is cross-fading or gap-less play in the plans?

I am on Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS (all updates as of the writing of this review). It integrates nicely but cosmetically-speaking (as others have mentioned) the icon is simply a mere placeholder cog vs the actual app, icon (please fix). But even that is meh in comparison to the bug of the "mini player" mode which flickers and flashes and tries to resize itself like its possessed across my screen (See here: https://youtu.be/Ev6lbfgNA9k ). Now, to be fair, I can unmaximize the album art in the mini mode and get it to stabilize…..but man oh man is it ever touchy and buggy. But everything else is awesome….please keep developing (and hopefully stabilizing) this app. Cheers!
summary: Decent web app with room for improvement

description: All our staff use this program. Apart from the icon bug up the top. Works flawless without any bugs so far.
Clean and simple. Keep it up!

On Ubuntu 18.04
Love that I can switch between my uploaded music in Google Play and my "Library" in YouTube whenever I want. Especially since YouTube will continue playing in the background, unlike on mobile devices...

One "negative" is that the icon in the topnavbar is not visible, but is still clickable.
Works just as expected to
thanks for building this app. Great job
I like the app and the way it functions but the generic icon I have on my dock bar lets it down

Locked up the whole computer! Pause didn't work, quit didn't work, couldn't even close the window. Had to shut down the whole thing to get out of this window.
Uninstalled!
Just needs an icon - other than that it's great.
Thank you for the app. Works very well. The only issue is exactly the same one reported by Foxmilk and others (with the icon)
The only issue I have is the icon is a bland default graphic, not what it is here :\

Fantastic job on the client! I love the look and feel. It's a must have for me on every device. I will say that It does however have quite a few issues here on the linux side. It doesn't install properly when you go through the site to get the .deb. and when it is installed it can be quite hard to get it to appear as clicking the icon in favorites will sometimes just outright not work. I usually have to go through the notification drawer which is one extra click I don't want to do when I go in and out of music several times an hour. fix this and it will be 5 stars for sure!
summary: It's amazing! Most of the time

description: The application works unlike the .deb package. But the program is very laggy/unresponsive. Don't get me wrong, the music plays fine without any lags or distortion. But the UI becomes laggy, clicks takes some time to work. UI takes a long time to update. Even the play/pause/stop buttons in the keyboard takes some time to act. First few minutes of launch it's okay but as time passes the unresponsiveness increases.
It's a great app, I'm enjoying it every single day! One small annoying issue is the icon which is not available. If it could be fixed it would be great. Aside from that perfect!
The app is good. However, I want to know how come this is not officially backed by Google.
summary: Why is it not an official Google project?

description: After logging into this app, I received repeated requests via my 2-phase authentication to access my Google account from Texas. Avoid like the plague.

Create independent app is a cool idea

I start the app, log into my account, it loads and says loading library but never loads the library. Before you say it is Google or my account. I can log in using Firefox or Chrome just fine it is only the player that stopped working.

"This browser or app may not be secure. Learn more

Try using a different browser. If you’re already using a supported browser, you can refresh your screen and try again to sign in."

https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/7675428?hl=en

description: Worked very well for a while - now it just hang at Loading Music Library. Could be 5 stars if it was more reliable.

I have been using this player for a long time, but today when I installed it on Ubuntu 19.10, I am trying to log in, and Google keeps telling me that the "browser or app may not be secure" and so it seems that I cannot use GPMDP to access my Google Account... This seems like very new behavior to me, as all my other installations of this software work properly.

Upon trying to login with my google account I receive the following error...

"""
Couldn't sign you in

This browser or app may not be secure. Learn more

Try using a different browser. If you’re already using a supported browser, you can refresh your screen and try again to sign in.
"""
Хорошее приложение со своей задачей справляется! Конечно, есть над чем работать, но это не критично! В целом смело рекомендую!
When installing from the snap store, switch to the Edge branch instead of Stable, otherwise it won't work in Ubuntu 19.10+
unfortunately this app won't work for me. It just hangs saying loading library. better off using the browser.
this app just loads the google play music website. thats all

It works well enough but it doesn't seem to have support for chromecast which I use to play music in my kitchen and on my deck using chromecast audio, this isn't a deal breaker but would be nice to have. What is the deal breaker? It doesn't seem to incorporate native media controls so I cant use my phone and GS-Connect to control playback. That is what I was really hoping this desktop player would allow me to do.
summary: It's fine but unfortunately missing features I use

doesnt work at all on my pc
Good Application for ubuntu users......

This app features extended features beyond what the web player has to offer (integration with other apps, complete control of theming, API exposure, etc). 

I am personally a fan of dark themes, so it's *really* nice to have that. There are also plenty of other custom themes that people have uploaded for you to use, if your adventurous enough to clone some git repos and follow those READMEs (hello to the fellow programmers out there)!

I have this on both Windows 10 and Ubuntu 20.04; no issues beyond the broken icon that other reviews have also mentioned.

The rest of this review may not entirely be relevant to the app, but I think it's worth mentioning.

Initially I was disappointed with the sound quality that I was getting on my HiFi setup, but this had nothing to do with the app. 
I found that it was an issue with the default configuration for pulse audio and ALSA (the frameworks/APIs to your sound card hardware). The guide I followed to fix that is here: (https://medium.com/@gamunu/enable-high-quality-audio-on-linux-6f16f3fe7e1f). Doing this improved the sound quality of my entire PC tenfold. I've never heard my equiptment sound so clear after the fact; definitely beat out any sound I could get out of windows in terms of distortion/noise.
